TopicTitle: Enough with the Criticism. This will lift your mood :)

Articles.Content:
In case you havent seen his post and I just thought this was worth to have its own Thread.

#WhackjobFanclub
Yay! Can't wait to see his newest monstrosities made of super-heavy parts!

Yay! Can't wait to see his newest monstrosities made of super-heavy parts!

As far as I know... he has very BIG plans in mind

Whackjob is almost a celebrity on this forum, and I think his fame is slightly overdone. Sure, I love his insane creations, but we don't need a thread from someone other than him claiming that his return will make us feel better about an update which quite a few people dislike.
I'd feel more comfortable if I saw a stable orbit. That trajectory looks questionable.
Im new to forums, who is he?

Whackjob is a dude who builds rockets most of us deem insane and overdesigned even by Kerbal standards, and he's been doing it long enough and to such a degree that he's become famous for it. If you do a forum search for threads by Whackjob or the word "Arkingthaad" you'll see what I'm talking about.

Im new to forums, who is he?

Take the biggest thing you can imagine, copy that and paste it 5 times over......then try to launch it. I do not know if he has any videos, but I am sure a search on the forums will yield results to your question.

Im new to forums, who is he?

A user who creates insane, massive, and usually very impractical rocket designs.

As Javster said, I agree that there is a bit too much hype surrounding him. No offense to him in the slightest; I love his creations but I don't think there should be yet another thread about Whackjob coming back and restoring the balance of the forums, or about how everyone is all depressed about how he's gone.

A user who creates insane, massive, and usually very impractical rocket designs.

As Javster said, I agree that there is a bit too much hype surrounding him. No offense to him in the slightest; I love his creations but I don't think there should be yet another thread about Whackjob coming back and restoring the balance of the forums, or about how everyone is all depressed about how he's gone.

Works of art are usually not practical, they're there to be admired, not to be used.

Whackjob's creations are works of art, they're massive, complicated, defy all rules that apply to real rockets and they still fly.

Take the biggest thing you can imagine, copy that and paste it 5 times over......then try to launch it. I do not know if he has any videos, but I am sure a search on the forums will yield results to your question.

Its worse, its worse than you can imgine

Guys, Whackjob is quite capable of posting on his own behalf, and even if he weren't, there are already several threads which discuss the man and his works. This thread is redundant, and will be closed now.
